public class SAMLAssertion
extends SAMLSignedObject
implements Cloneable

Represents a SAML Assertion

Author:
Scott Cantor (created March 18, 2002), Tom Scavo

SAMLAssertion

public SAMLAssertion()
Default constructor

SAMLAssertion

public SAMLAssertion(String issuer,
                     Date notBefore,
                     Date notOnOrAfter,
                     Collection conditions,
                     Collection advice,
                     Collection statements)
              throws SAMLException
Builds an assertion out of its component parts

Parameters:
issuer - Name of SAML authority issuing assertion
notBefore - Optional start of validity
notOnOrAfter - Optional end of validity
conditions - Set of conditions on validity
advice - Optional advice content
statements - Set of SAML statements to place in assertion
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if an assertion cannot be constructed from the supplied information

                     Collection conditions,
                     Collection advice,
                     Collection statements)
              throws SAMLException
Builds an assertion out of its component parts

Parameters:
assertionId - Unique identifier for assertion
issueInstant - Time of issuance
issuer - Name of SAML authority issuing assertion
notBefore - Optional start of validity
notOnOrAfter - Optional end of validity
conditions - Set of conditions on validity
advice - Optional advice content
statements - Set of SAML statements to place in assertion
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if an assertion cannot be constructed from the supplied information

checkValidity

public void checkValidity()
                   throws SAMLException
Description copied from class: SAMLObject
Evaluates the object's content to see if it is currently valid if serialized. Does not evaluate embedded objects except on the basis of whether they exist. For example, an Assertion must have a Statement, but if an invalid statement is added, SAMLAssertion.checkValidity() would succeed, while SAMLStatement.checkValidity would raise an exception.

Specified by:
checkValidity in class SAMLObject
Throws:
SAMLException - Raised if the serialized object would be invalid SAML, excluding any embedded objects
See Also:
SAMLObject.checkValidity()
